active_learning.discussion_prompt: Compare NIST SP 800-61r3 incident phases with the SANS Institute model. In a simulated data breach at a financial firm, debate which framework better supports rapid containment versus thorough post-incident analysis. Address the misconception that all security events are incidents.
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, explain the differences between 'security event' (e.g., login failure), 'incident' (e.g., unauthorized access), and 'data breach' (e.g., exfiltrated data) using real and non-examples. Then, teach-back to the group and map to tools like Splunk for logging events.
active_learning.problem_solving: In groups, design an incident tracking workflow for a ransomware scenario using a free tool like Trello or Jira. Apply NIST steps from detection to recovery, map to business continuity plans, and present optimizations like collaboration features and reporting.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Incident Management and Tracking Applications' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Business Continuity Planning > Technology and Automation > BCM Software and Tools > Incident Management and Tracking Applications). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards (20 Basic Q&A, 20 MCQ, 10 Scenario-Based) optimized for Anki/Quizlet, covering all Bloom's levels and scaffolding layers. Ensure 100% coverage of NIST SP 800-61r3 (full phases: Preparation, Detection/Analysis, Containment/Eradication/Recovery, Post-Incident), ISO 22301, ITIL; tools: Splunk, ServiceNow IRM, TheHive, PagerDuty, Jira, Trello; integrations: SIEM/SOAR/BCP. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [PASTE FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Use prompts/activities for scenario cards. - Scaffolding: Distribute cards: 15% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 30% Layer 3, 30% Layer 4. - Schema: Strictly follow [FLASHCARD_SCHEMA ABOVE]. Key Content: - Definitions: Cybersecurity incident (CIA violation, NIST), event (benign observable), breach (data exfil). - Tools: Splunk (analytics), ServiceNow (IRM workflows), etc. - Sources: NIST SP 800-61r3 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-61r3.pdf), CREST Guide, Concertium. Output JSON array: [{'type': '...', 'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'layer': '1-4', 'bloom': '...', 'tags': ['nist','tool']}, ...]. Vary difficulty; promote active recall.
